page.title: 14HOUSING
page.content: The majority of houses in this block is made up of 2-storey houses with sloping slated roofs.(For other types see LANDSCAPE -URBAN-VILLAGE page 7). The older houses in the district are built of mason-shaped stone and lime, most with the stone showing, but a few are covered with rough-cast.The more recently built houses are constructed of concrete blocks (cavity walls),and the most recent houses (bungalows) are mostly of the timber-framed kit type with tiled roofs. A few years back the cavity-walled council houses were given extra insulation in the form of polystyrene foam filling.
